questions.question: Who was the first man created by God according to the Bible?
questions.explanation: Adam was the first human created by God as recorded in Genesis 2:7.

questions.question: On which day did God create human beings?
questions.explanation: God created human beings on the sixth day of creation (Genesis 1:26-31).

questions.question: What was the first sin committed by humans?
questions.explanation: Adam and Eve ate the forbidden fruit from the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

questions.question: Who was the first murderer in the Bible?
questions.explanation: Cain killed his brother Abel out of jealousy (Genesis 4:8).

questions.question: Why did God send the flood in Noah's time?
questions.explanation: God saw that human wickedness was great on earth (Genesis 6:5).

questions.question: How many people were saved in the ark?
questions.explanation: Noah, his wife, his three sons and their wives - eight people total (1 Peter 3:20).

questions.question: What was God's covenant with Noah after the flood?

options.A: Never to destroy earth with flood again
options.B: To make him father of nations

questions.explanation: God set the rainbow as sign of His covenant never to flood the earth again (Genesis 9:11).

questions.question: Who was called the father of faith?
questions.explanation: Abraham is called the father of faith because he believed God's promises (Romans 4:16).

questions.question: What was the sign of God's covenant with Abraham?
questions.explanation: Circumcision was the physical sign of God's covenant with Abraham (Genesis 17:10).

questions.question: What was Abraham's original name?
questions.explanation: God changed his name from Abram (exalted father) to Abraham (father of many nations).

questions.question: Who was Abraham's wife?
questions.explanation: Sarah was Abraham's wife and mother of Isaac (Genesis 17:15).

questions.question: How old was Abraham when Isaac was born?
questions.explanation: Abraham was 100 years old when Isaac was born (Genesis 21:5).

questions.question: Who was Abraham's first son?
questions.explanation: Ishmael was born to Hagar, Sarah's maidservant, before Isaac.

questions.question: What test did God give Abraham concerning his son?
questions.explanation: God tested Abraham's faith by asking him to sacrifice Isaac (Genesis 22:2).

questions.question: Who was Isaac's wife?
questions.explanation: Rebekah was Isaac's wife and mother of Jacob and Esau.

questions.question: Who tricked Isaac to get the blessing?
questions.explanation: Jacob, with his mother's help, tricked Isaac into giving him the firstborn's blessing.

questions.question: What was Jacob's name changed to?
questions.explanation: God changed Jacob's name to Israel after wrestling with him (Genesis 32:28).

questions.question: How many sons did Jacob have?
questions.explanation: Jacob had twelve sons who became the twelve tribes of Israel.

questions.question: Who was Jacob's favorite son?
questions.explanation: Joseph was Jacob's favorite son, which made his brothers jealous.

questions.question: What did Joseph's dreams symbolize?

options.A: His family would bow to him

questions.explanation: Joseph dreamed that his family would bow down to him, angering his brothers.

questions.question: How did Joseph end up in Egypt?
questions.explanation: Joseph's brothers sold him to Ishmaelite traders going to Egypt.

questions.question: Why was Joseph put in prison in Egypt?
questions.explanation: Potiphar's wife falsely accused Joseph of trying to seduce her.

questions.question: What was Joseph's position in Egypt?
questions.explanation: Pharaoh made Joseph prime minister after he interpreted his dreams.

questions.question: Who led the Israelites out of Egypt?
questions.explanation: Moses was chosen by God to lead the Israelites from Egyptian slavery.

questions.question: How did God appear to Moses?
questions.explanation: God appeared to Moses in a burning bush that wasn't consumed.

questions.question: What was Moses' excuse when God called him?
questions.explanation: Moses said he was slow of speech and not eloquent.

questions.question: Who was Moses' spokesman?
questions.explanation: Aaron, Moses' brother, became his spokesman before Pharaoh.

questions.question: How many plagues did God send on Egypt?
questions.explanation: God sent ten plagues to convince Pharaoh to free the Israelites.

questions.question: What was the final plague?
questions.explanation: The death of all firstborn Egyptians was the final plague.

questions.question: What feast commemorates the Exodus?
questions.explanation: Passover commemorates God passing over Israelite homes during the final plague.

questions.question: How did Israelites cross the Red Sea?
questions.explanation: God miraculously divided the Red Sea for Israelites to cross on dry ground.

questions.question: Where did God give the Ten Commandments?
questions.explanation: God gave Moses the Ten Commandments on Mount Sinai.

questions.question: What is the first commandment?
questions.explanation: The first commandment is to have no other gods before the Lord.

questions.question: What was in the Ark of the Covenant?

options.A: Tablets of law, manna, Aaron's rod

questions.explanation: The Ark contained the stone tablets, golden jar of manna, and Aaron's rod.

questions.question: Who succeeded Moses as leader?
questions.explanation: Joshua was chosen by God to lead Israel after Moses' death.

questions.question: How did Israelites conquer Jericho?
questions.explanation: God instructed them to march around Jericho for seven days.

questions.question: Who was the first king of Israel?
questions.explanation: Saul was anointed as Israel's first king by Samuel.

questions.question: Who defeated Goliath?
questions.explanation: David, a young shepherd, defeated the giant Goliath with a sling.

questions.question: What was David's great sin?
questions.explanation: David committed adultery with Bathsheba and arranged Uriah's death.

questions.question: Who built the first temple in Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Solomon built the first temple as God had promised David.

questions.question: What was Solomon known for?
questions.explanation: Solomon was famous for his wisdom, wealth, and building projects.

questions.question: After Solomon, the kingdom split into:
questions.explanation: After Solomon, the kingdom divided into Northern Israel and Southern Judah.

questions.question: Who was the prophet who confronted Ahab?
questions.explanation: Elijah confronted King Ahab and Queen Jezebel about their idolatry.

questions.question: Where did Elijah challenge Baal's prophets?
questions.explanation: Elijah challenged Baal's prophets on Mount Carmel in a fire contest.

questions.question: Who succeeded Elijah?
questions.explanation: Elisha was chosen by God to succeed Elijah as prophet.

questions.question: Who was thrown into lions' den?
questions.explanation: Daniel was thrown into lions' den for praying to God against the king's decree.

questions.question: Who interpreted dreams for Nebuchadnezzar?
questions.explanation: Daniel interpreted King Nebuchadnezzar's dreams in Babylon.

questions.question: Who were the three Hebrew men in fiery furnace?
questions.explanation: Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego were thrown into fiery furnace but saved by God.

questions.question: Who was the mother of Jesus?
questions.explanation: Mary, a virgin, was chosen by God to bear Jesus through the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: Where was Jesus born?
questions.explanation: Jesus was born in Bethlehem as prophesied by Micah.

questions.question: Who were the first visitors to baby Jesus?
questions.explanation: Shepherds were the first to visit Jesus after angelic announcement.

questions.question: How many wise men visited Jesus?
questions.explanation: The Bible mentions wise men but doesn't specify how many; tradition says three.

questions.question: Who baptized Jesus?
questions.explanation: John the Baptist baptized Jesus in the Jordan River.

questions.question: What sign appeared when Jesus was baptized?
questions.explanation: The Holy Spirit descended like a dove and God spoke from heaven.

questions.question: How long was Jesus tempted in the wilderness?
questions.explanation: Jesus was tempted by Satan for 40 days in the wilderness.

questions.question: What was Jesus' first miracle?
questions.explanation: Jesus turned water into wine at the wedding in Cana.

questions.question: How many disciples did Jesus choose?
questions.explanation: Jesus chose twelve disciples to be his closest followers.

questions.question: What is the Sermon on the Mount?
questions.explanation: The Sermon on the Mount contains Jesus' fundamental teachings.

questions.question: What are the Beatitudes?
questions.explanation: The Beatitudes are eight blessings taught by Jesus in Sermon on Mount.

questions.question: What is the Golden Rule?

options.A: Do to others as you want them to do to you

questions.explanation: The Golden Rule summarizes how we should treat others.

questions.question: How did Jesus feed 5000 people?
questions.explanation: Jesus miraculously multiplied 5 loaves and 2 fish to feed 5000.

questions.question: Who walked on water with Jesus?
questions.explanation: Peter walked on water toward Jesus but began to sink when afraid.

questions.question: Who was raised from dead by Jesus?
questions.explanation: Jesus raised Lazarus, Jairus' daughter, and a widow's son from death.

questions.question: What is the parable of the Good Samaritan about?
questions.explanation: It teaches that anyone in need is our neighbor, regardless of background.

questions.question: What is the parable of the Prodigal Son about?
questions.explanation: It illustrates God's unconditional love and forgiveness for repentant sinners.

questions.question: Who betrayed Jesus?
questions.explanation: Judas Iscariot betrayed Jesus for thirty pieces of silver.

questions.question: What was the Last Supper?
questions.explanation: The Last Supper was Jesus' final meal with disciples before crucifixion.

questions.question: What did Jesus institute at Last Supper?
questions.explanation: Jesus instituted Communion using bread and wine as symbols of his body and blood.

questions.question: Where was Jesus arrested?
questions.explanation: Jesus was arrested in Garden of Gethsemane after praying.

questions.question: Who denied Jesus three times?
questions.explanation: Peter denied knowing Jesus three times as Jesus predicted.

questions.question: Who sentenced Jesus to death?
questions.explanation: Pontius Pilate, the Roman governor, sentenced Jesus to crucifixion.

questions.question: Where was Jesus crucified?
questions.explanation: Jesus was crucified at Golgotha, meaning 'place of the skull'.

questions.question: What was written on Jesus' cross?

options.A: Jesus of Nazareth, King of the Jews
options.B: This is the Son of God

questions.explanation: The inscription read 'Jesus of Nazareth, King of the Jews' in three languages.

questions.question: Who buried Jesus?
questions.explanation: Joseph of Arimathea, a secret disciple, buried Jesus in his own tomb.

questions.question: On which day did Jesus rise?
questions.explanation: Jesus rose from dead on the third day after crucifixion.

questions.question: Who were first to find empty tomb?
questions.explanation: Women who followed Jesus were first to discover the empty tomb.

questions.question: How many days between resurrection and ascension?
questions.explanation: Jesus appeared to disciples for 40 days after resurrection before ascending.

questions.question: Where did Jesus ascend to heaven?
questions.explanation: Jesus ascended to heaven from the Mount of Olives near Jerusalem.

questions.question: What happened at Pentecost?
questions.explanation: The Holy Spirit descended on disciples with power, beginning the Church.

questions.question: Who was the first martyr?
questions.explanation: Stephen was stoned to death for preaching about Jesus.

questions.question: Who persecuted Christians before conversion?
questions.explanation: Paul (Saul) persecuted Christians before his dramatic conversion.

questions.question: How was Paul converted?

options.A: Jesus appeared to him on road to Damascus

questions.explanation: Jesus appeared to Paul in bright light on road to Damascus.

questions.question: What was Paul's occupation?
questions.explanation: Paul was a tentmaker who supported himself while ministering.

questions.question: How many missionary journeys did Paul make?
questions.explanation: Paul made three major missionary journeys spreading the gospel.

questions.question: Who was Paul's main missionary companion?
questions.explanation: Barnabas was Paul's first major missionary partner.

questions.question: Where was Paul shipwrecked?
questions.explanation: Paul was shipwrecked on Malta during voyage to Rome.

questions.question: How many books did Paul write in New Testament?
questions.explanation: Paul wrote 13 New Testament letters (Romans through Philemon).

questions.question: What is the theme of Romans?
questions.explanation: Romans emphasizes salvation by grace through faith in Christ.

questions.question: What are the fruits of the Spirit?
questions.explanation: Galatians 5 lists love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, self-control.

questions.question: What is the armor of God?
questions.explanation: Ephesians 6 describes spiritual armor like helmet of salvation, shield of faith.

questions.question: Who wrote the book of Revelation?
questions.explanation: The Apostle John wrote Revelation while exiled on Patmos.

questions.question: What is Revelation about?
questions.explanation: Revelation prophesies about end times, Christ's victory, and new creation.

questions.question: What are the four Gospels?
questions.explanation: The four Gospels present Jesus' life from different perspectives.

questions.question: Which Gospel emphasizes Jesus as Messiah?
questions.explanation: Matthew presents Jesus as the promised Jewish Messiah.

questions.question: Which Gospel emphasizes Jesus as Servant?
questions.explanation: Mark portrays Jesus as the suffering servant.

questions.question: Which Gospel emphasizes Jesus as Son of Man?
questions.explanation: Luke presents Jesus as the perfect Son of Man who came to save all people.

questions.question: Which Gospel emphasizes Jesus as Son of God?
questions.explanation: John emphasizes Jesus' divine nature as eternal Son of God.

questions.question: What are the synoptic Gospels?
questions.explanation: Matthew, Mark, and Luke are called synoptic because they share similar content and structure.

questions.question: How many books in New Testament?
questions.explanation: The New Testament contains 27 books from Matthew to Revelation.

questions.question: How many books in Old Testament?
questions.explanation: The Old Testament contains 39 books from Genesis to Malachi.

questions.question: What are the first five books of Bible called?
questions.explanation: Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, Deuteronomy are called Pentateuch or Torah.

questions.question: Who wrote most of the Psalms?
questions.explanation: David wrote about half of the 150 Psalms in the Bible.

questions.question: What is the longest book in Bible?
questions.explanation: Psalms is the longest book with 150 chapters.

questions.question: What is the shortest verse in Bible?
questions.explanation: John 11:35 'Jesus wept' is the shortest verse in most English translations.

questions.question: What are the Ten Commandments?
questions.explanation: The Ten Commandments are fundamental moral laws God gave Moses.

questions.question: What is the Great Commission?
questions.explanation: Jesus commanded his followers to make disciples of all nations.

questions.question: What is the Great Commandment?

options.C: Do to others as you want

questions.explanation: Jesus said the greatest commandments are to love God completely and love neighbor as self.

questions.question: What is justification?
questions.explanation: Justification is God declaring sinners righteous through faith in Christ.

questions.question: What is sanctification?
questions.explanation: Sanctification is the lifelong process of becoming more like Christ.

questions.question: What is redemption?

options.A: Being bought from slavery to sin

questions.explanation: Redemption means Christ paid the price to free us from sin's slavery.

questions.question: What is grace?
questions.explanation: Grace is God's free gift of salvation we don't deserve.

questions.question: What is faith?
questions.explanation: Biblical faith involves trust, commitment, and reliance on God.

questions.question: What is repentance?
questions.explanation: Repentance involves changing mind about sin and turning to God.

questions.question: What is the Trinity?
questions.explanation: The Trinity is one God eternally existing as Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.

questions.question: What is the Incarnation?
questions.explanation: The Incarnation is God the Son taking on human flesh in Jesus.

questions.question: What is the Atonement?

options.A: Christ's work on cross for salvation

questions.explanation: Atonement refers to Christ's sacrificial death reconciling us to God.

questions.question: What is the Church?
questions.explanation: The Church is all believers in Christ across time and place.

questions.question: What are the sacraments/ordinances?
questions.explanation: Most Protestants observe two ordinances: baptism and communion.

questions.question: What is baptism?
questions.explanation: Baptism symbolizes identification with Christ's death and resurrection.

questions.question: What is the Lord's Supper?
questions.explanation: Communion remembers Jesus' death and anticipates his return.

questions.question: What is prayer?
questions.explanation: Prayer is talking and listening to God in relationship.

questions.question: What is worship?
questions.explanation: Worship is ascribing to God the worth and honor He deserves.

questions.question: What is evangelism?
questions.explanation: Evangelism is proclaiming the good news of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What is discipleship?
questions.explanation: Discipleship means being a committed follower of Jesus.

questions.question: What is stewardship?
questions.explanation: Stewardship recognizes God owns everything and we manage it for Him.

questions.question: What is the Second Coming?
questions.explanation: The Second Coming is Jesus' promised return to judge and reign.

questions.question: What is the Resurrection?

options.A: Rising from dead to eternal life

questions.explanation: Believers will be raised with imperishable bodies like Christ's.

questions.question: What is eternal life?

options.A: Quality and quantity of life with God

questions.explanation: Eternal life begins now through knowing God and continues forever in His presence.
